result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis M Walton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1g.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

09:49 AM Defendant Travis M Walton appeared in custody by phone from MSDF.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    The parties agreed to have the hearing conducted remotely under the Standing COVID-19 Order requirements. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Court questioned defendant regarding motion.  
Court calls case to address defendant's pro se motion for sentence modification.  
Defendant makes statements regarding motion. 
State objects to motion for sentence modification.
For reasons as stated on the record, the Court denies the motion for sentence modification.

Defendant Travis M Walton in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern & Attorney Shawn Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ashley L.  addresses the Court on behalf of the Defendant.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following on Count #1.


IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

4 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 0 days) (CONSECUTIVE TO CURRENT SENTENCE)
  -  1 YEAR OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done, surcharge waived.

COURT COSTS:  WAIVED;


Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant Travis M Walton in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R. Fragoso.   Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Detective Tim Probst from the City of Waukesha Police Department, sworn and testified. Cross examination by Atty. Fragoso. Re direct by the State. Re cross examination by Atty. Fragoso. State rests. No testimony provided by the defense. State movces for bind over and provides closing statements. Closing statements presented by Atty. Fragoso and objects to the bind over.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed.
